references.reason: This paper is foundational to the current work because it introduces GPT-4, a large language model utilized by the authors to generate action phrases for the creation of a common action space.

references.paper_title: Learning transferable visual models from natural language supervision
references.reason: CLIP, introduced in this paper, is a crucial component of TwinAct as the action encoder which provides the inductive bias to decouple actions from actors, enabling precise customization without actor-related details.

references.paper_title: An image is worth one word: Personalizing text-to-image generation using textual inversion
references.reason: This paper introduces Textual Inversion, a technique that allows for the customization of text-guided diffusion models, which is a relevant prior technique that TwinAct builds upon and improves on.

references.paper_title: High-resolution image synthesis with latent diffusion models
references.reason: This paper introduces Stable Diffusion, the text-guided diffusion model which forms the foundation for the work presented in this paper and upon which TwinAct is based.

references.paper_title: DreamBooth: Fine tuning text-to-image diffusion models for subject-driven generation
references.reason: This paper introduces DreamBooth, a technique used to customize actors in image generation, which is an important prior method that TwinAct improves upon by focusing specifically on decoupling actions and actors.
